p: Diverse species of this genus are extensively applied in Chinese and Indian folk medicine as a stimulant for milk secretion, analgesic, antityphus, to expel miasma, calm stomach ache diuretic and reduce asthma attack [ 4, 5]. In recent years, various pharmacological effects of Echinops have been investigated, such as antifungal [ 6, 7], antiprotozoal [ 8, 9], antipyretic [ 10], reproductive [ 11], hepatoprotective [ 12– 14], anti-cancer [ 15– 17], antioxidant [ 18– 20], antifeedant [ 21], anti-inflammatory [ 22– 24] and antibacterial [ 25– 29]. According to our survey, only few reports are found about their immunomodulatory effects in the literature. Tehrani et al. investigated the effect of the methanol extract of Echinops ilicifolius on peripheral blood mononuclear cells proliferation and interleukin (IL)-4 secretions [ 30].
